name: Premier Inn Durham City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned home from a 2 night stay at the Premier Inn Durham. The hotel was just as good as the previous reviews say - a huge comfy bed, a great shower in a nice clean bathroom and its location near to numerous busy bars and restaurants was perfect for us, although this might not be to everyone's taste. We were in a room to the side of the hotel (Room 405) overlooking the swimming pool next door, so outside noise was not a factor for us.We didn't eat or drink in the hotel, so can't comment on that but we can certainly confirm that the staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful and professional (particularly Donna who was on reception when we arrived and departed). All in all a super base for us to visit wonderful Durham - I would not hesitate to recommend it and look forward to returning one day.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location handy for shops restaurants, pubs including Wetherspoons. Lovely spotlessly clean modern room and superior bathroom without the off-putting black mould on the grout that most other hotels are guilty of. Best of all were the staff who went out of their way to be helpful at the same time always friendly and smiling.
reviews.title: Best Premier Inn I have stayed in

reviews.text: Secure parking in next door multi-storey car park at £7 a day where you can take the car in and out as much as you wish.
reviews.title: A superior standard Premier Inn - perfectly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this Premier Inn to anyone.
reviews.title: Service with a smile - Fantastic Hotel, Location & Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travellin up from Kent to enjoy a Bank Holiday break with friends who live near Durham we embarked on our journey late Friday night thinkin we'd got the travel situation completely sussed. Hmmmm, didn't factor in chaos round the M20, Dartford Tunnel n M25 after an earlier accident. Thought at this point it might be wise to advise the Premier Inn that we were most definitely goin to be a late arrival. The lady who took my call could not have been more helpful n when I mentioned that we were travellin 300 miles with two 9 year olds n didn't expect to be with her until about 1am she kindly enquired if we would like any sandwiches after our journey n made me aware that the bar would still be open for a well deserved nightcap for us and a hot chocolate for the girls. Very impressed with that level of service!
reviews.title: Outstanding example of how a budget hotel should be run.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable, new and everything works! The staff were helpful and friendly. Only downside is that it is difficult to walk to the train station with luggage - a 5 pound taxi is the only real option. I don't know what parking is available.
reviews.title: Comfortable, well located and excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good hotel. Simple, straightforward, but done well with excellent staff particularly the lady who served breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Car parking and access by road to the hotel can be interesting to say the least. Set the sat nav very carefully. The open air car park across the road cost £2. 40 for the night and the traffic warden was really helpful in explaining how to get the overnight stay rate. But actually the meter is set up for it.
reviews.title: Excellent service in a good location
Clean, comfortable, affordable--and dull
reviews.text: Arrived in Durham at 5.30 and of course even in a major tourist town in England all the shops were closing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main thing to impress us was the first rate service. Whether asking for an iron, storing the case after check out or calling a taxi, we felt they could not do enough. Although breakast on the Monday was bit slow due to many guests coming at once, the waitress was very pleasant, kept her cool, apologised and explained what was going on. You cant get cross with people like that. The room was fine, though I wish they would provide more than one easy chair - and even that is not very comfortable. We were worried about noise from a nearby pub and the heating vents below the window, but the sound insulation must be good as we were not disturbed. The bar and restaurant area looked welcoming and breakfast was good. The location near the centre of the city is good, though it is an arduous walk with a heavy case from the station. All in all good value and did what it said on the tin.
reviews.title: Good Quality Budget Accomodation

reviews.text: Stayed at the premier inn Sat & Sun night. Was able to leave our bags to explore the area before we checked in at 2pm. Delighted with room - very clean & light. Didn't stay for evening meal, but breakfast couldn't be faulted - everything cooked to order & eat as much as you like.
reviews.title: Excellent price & location!
Excellent
reviews.text: The location is excellent for exploring Durham. I travelled with my elderly mother who's walking isn't so good. However we didn't have any worries. There is a lift up to the shops level just down the road from the hotel, and the local city bus stops across the road taking you to the cathedral & is only 50p all day (free if you have a bus pass!). The new leisure centre is next door if you fancy a swim!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, and will stay here again the next time I visit Durham.
reviews.title: Right in the centre, excellent value for money

reviews.text: One word of caution. We had a room on the "quiet" side of the hotel overlooking the road. Although we didn't have any noise inside the hotel, we were disturbed throughout Sat night by the late night revellers leaving the bars & clubs behind the hotel. Things were quiet on the Sun night tho'. I would guess that the noise is worse at the back of the hotel which overlooks all the bars & eating places. Ask for a quiet room if that's your preference.
reviews.title: Adequate and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good value.

reviews.text: Delighted with my last minute stay here which literally saved me sleeping rough in the frost!
reviews.title: Checked in at 3am .. can't fault them!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely big room, comfy bed, nice bathroom, friendly staff .. can't fault it.
reviews.title: Great location excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights room was the usual high standard shower was brilliant. Restaurant and bar a bit on the small side but can cope with the amount of guests. Very central to all Durham has to offer with bars and restuarants within two minutes walking distance. Can be a bit noisy late at night as revellers make their way home but that seems to be only at weekends. Multi-storey car parking to the back of the hotel very reasonable at £8 per 24 hours. ( £6 if you get the hotel to stamp your ticket ) Swimming pool and ice rink right next door to hotel.
reviews.title: Central, clean, would stay here again

reviews.text: After stumbling across the glowing reviews for the Durham Premier Inn on Tripadvisor, we decided to book for New Year's Eve. It was a little tricky to find, but didn't take too long. As previous reviewers have said, it doesn't have a car park, but there is one right next to it. I think we paid 6 pounds for 24 hours.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (number 208) was fine - not big, but not cramped. It did look straight out onto the Slug and Lettuce however, and there was some noise from bottle-collections, so if you need quiet then ask for a room on the other side of the building.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

aka: Premier Inn Durham City Centre Hotel Durham
